title: Graph of power as function of resistance

content.question: A variable resistor is connected across a constant voltage source. Which of the following graphs represents the power P dissipated by the resistor as a function of its resistance R?

choices.label: A graph plots i versus t. The graph shows a concave up, decreasing curve starting from a point near the vertical axis at the top and then moving downward.
A graph plots P versus R. The graph shows a line falling from the vertical axis to the horizontal axis.
A graph plots P versus R. The graph shows a concave up increasing curve rising from the origin.
A graph plots P versus R. The graph shows a concave down increasing curve rising from the origin.
A graph plots P versus R. The graph shows a line rising from the origin.

content.answer: A graph plots i versus t. The graph shows a concave up, decreasing curve starting from a point near the vertical axis at the top and then moving downward.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
